conclusion: Problem involves an electron in a uniform electric field between two charged plates.
Electron starts at point O with initial velocity v₀ perpendicular to electric field.
Electron exits at point C with velocity forming a 30° angle with initial direction.
Need to find kinetic energy of electron at point C.
Two parallel plates create a uniform electric field.
Electron follows a curved path due to electric force.
Force on electron is constant and perpendicular to initial velocity.
Electron experiences uniform acceleration perpendicular to initial motion.
Kinetic energy is (1/2)mv²; need velocity at point C.
Electron has constant velocity in horizontal direction and constant acceleration in vertical direction.
Horizontal direction is x-axis, vertical is y-axis; electric field along y-axis.
Force on electron is F = eE; acceleration a_y = eE/m.
Time to travel horizontal distance L is t = L / v₀.
Velocity components at point C: v_x = v₀, v_y = v₀ * tan(30°).
Magnitude of velocity at C is v = v₀ * sqrt(4/3).
Kinetic energy at C is (2/3) m v₀².
Realization that kinetic energy should relate to work done by electric field.
